UNIVAR USA INC. RMP COMPLIANCE AND DOCUMENTATION MANUAL

01/24/03 Replaces: New .                               Page

1 of 3





                          RMP PLAN

                      EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

                              

COMPANY OVERVIEW

Univar  USA Inc. is a wholesale chemical distributor serving

a  number  of U.S. industries. Founded in 1924,  Univar  USA

supplies    the   food   industry,   chemical   compounders,

pharmaceuticals,  mining,  forest  products,  oil  and   gas

producers,   electronics,  coatings  and  many   other   key

industries  with  the  raw chemical  materials  required  to

produce or refine products used in numerous end-use markets.

Univar  USA Inc. is a member of the National Association  of

Chemical   distributors  (NACD)  and   complies   with   the

Responsible  Distribution Process (RDP),  an  environmental,

health and safety improvement initiative.

Some  of  the  products  stored and handled  by  Univar  are

subject  to EPA's Risk Management Program rule (40 CFR  Part

68).  A key requirement of this rule is the preparation  and

submission of an RMP Plan, contained herein. The contents of

the RMP Plan are prescribed by EPA, including this Executive

Summary.





CORPORATE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE APPROACH



1. Prevention Program

     Processes  that  are subject to OSHA's  Process  Safety

     management (PSM) standard AND are regulated under EPA's

     RMP  rule  are  subject  to the  Program  3  Prevention

     program.  Univar USA Inc. has documented the Prevention

     Program   in  its  Process  Safety  Management  Manual.

     Briefly,   this   program   includes   provisions   and

     requirements for:

     > Process Safety Information

     > Process Hazard Analysis

     > Operating Procedures

     > Training

     > Mechanical Integrity

     > Management

     of Change >

     Pre-Startup

     Review

  > Compliance

     Audits

     > Incident

     Investigatio

n > Employee

     Participatio

     n > Hot Work

     permits

     >

Contractors

2. Emergency Response Approach

Univar USA Inc. has an Emergency Contingency

Plan in place. This Plan

is shared with local emergency responders who

have access to Univar facility personnel (and up-

to-date phone numbers). Univar responds to minor

incidents but will call in professional

emergency responders in the event of all other

incidents.

Univar  USA  Inc.  invites  and encourages

local  emergency responders  such  as  the  fire

department  to  visit   and familiarize

themselves with Univar products and facilities.

Joint emergency exercises are conducted when

possible.

STATIONARY SOURCE

Univar USA Inc. in St. Paul is a distributor for

35% and 37% solutions of formaldehyde.  These

solutions are used as mild reducing agents in

proprietary electroless plating products, and

in  livestock  rearing and dairy farms  to

treat  hoof maladies in cattle, sheep, goats,

and horses, for instance.



These  solutions are stored in 55 gallon plastic

drums which are   compliant   with   all

applicable   regulations   for transportation

by highway per the federal  DOT  laws.   The

number   of   drums   at  this  Univar

facility   contains formaldehyde  in  amounts

moderately above  the  EPA's   RMP regulatory

threshold.



WORST-CASE RELEASE SCENARIO(S)

Trained forklift operators, strong containers,

and a  secure facility minimize the potential

for a chemical release.  The worst  case is the

release of 485 pounds (one full drum)  of 37%

formaldehyde solution over a 10 minute period.

This  is a      release of 180 pounds of pure

formaldehyde, at a rate  of

18  pounds  per  minute.   Under these

conditions,  without mitigation,  a  toxic

concentration of formaldehyde  vapors would  be

present out to about 320 feet from  the  pool

of liquid.



The  vapor

concentration  would  be  reduced,

outside  the building,  by  closing  the

facility  doors,  thus  greatly mitigating the

flow of vapors to the environment.



ALTERNATIVE CASE RELEASE SCENARIO(S)

The  alternate release calculation (model) is

for a  smaller amount  at the almost the same

rate (17 pounds per  minute), over a 5 minute

period, but with more sever weather effects. The

toxic concentration endpoint is the same, with

no public toxic effects more than 320 feet from

the released liquid.

GENERAL  PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL-

SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS

As  outlined previously, Univar is subject to

OSHA's Process Safety  Management regulation and

utilizes this  program  to meet the prevention

program requirements under RMP. Chemical-

specific prevention steps include the following:

 O    Standard operating procedures for loading,

                   unloading,

     and storage.

O    Personnel training and documentation

O    A hazard communication program

O    A well designed facility with smooth floors

and wide

aisles

O    A program to manage changes

O    A maintenance program for facility and

equipment

O    Safety audits

O    Corrective

action programs

O    Employee

participation

O    Contractor management

O    Emergency action and contingency planning







ACCIDENT HISTORY

There have not been any accidents or releases

related to the covered     process     in

the     past     5     years. .



EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM

We  have  an  Emergency  Contingency  Plan

which  has  been communicated to the city of St.

Paul Department of Fire  and Safety Services.



We practice employee emergency action and

mitigation procedures along with evacuation

drills.
